page.title: 15 Housing
page.content: The provision of new{sewers}for {Longhope and Huntley}in the early 1970's led to the building of new estates. Many new houses were built in{Longhope}on land previously used for orchards. Many of the buyers had young families and wanted to live in the country yet close to the city of{ {Gloucester}.To the local people this meant a change from traditional villagers with people from many areas of Britain moving in as jobs etc. dictated. Most of the new houses are {owner-occupied}although some{council {housing}is provided and some older houses are tied to the farms or Church. Small gardens are supplemented by allotments, the surrounding fields and open countryside give a feeling of space.
